intro: Limeum aethiopicum var. glabrum, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its glabrous (smooth) leaves and compact growth habit make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
